Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
you will notice that branch appears to prit way more erros on MoMoM imports ... but its not.. .we just need to change what its saying. 
What happend on the old tests what the MoMoM hash on the target chain couldnt be found, so now it looks for the KMD txid height, then scans 100 block alla round it until it gets a match  .. not very eleagent but at least it appears to work 100% of the time now.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It ws just a horroble hack, where the pubkeys were copied into a part of the memory that tricked it into ntarising

Content: Now it actualyl identifies your -pubkey

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: wether your KMD or a staked chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and when the eras change, your node wil autromatically know its not a ntoary any more

Content: Should allow us to make CC contracts for NN, such aspay per notaisation,as ther eis alwaays an array with all the ntoary R address avalible now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r i am interested in creating valid notarization data in regtest mode, so that automated tests for dpowconfs can be written. I am interested in solving this for KMD+AC's and external coins as well. Currently I am trying to test that dpowconfs work correctly in Hush, but KMD itself could also use dpowconf tests, as well as any coin that adds DPoW

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r it seems like you may already have a solution to this, so I wanted to ask your opinion. If not, it seems that the list of notary pubkeys must take into account NetworkID, and if it's not mainnet, we list at least 13 pubkeys with known private keys, that can be imported in regtest mode

Author: blackjok3r#3181
blackjok3r#3181
Content: Thoe other problem your going to face is how to get notarisations into regtest mode...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe add a notarisation tx to every mined block ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r i am thinking about saving the raw transactions, and then broadcasting them in regtest + mining them, when the test runs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's OK to have the same exact notarization data each test run

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Report on my migrates so far is GOOD NEWS!
CFEKED : 2985 confirmed import, with 0 fails
CFEKING: 2939 confirmed import, with 1 fail reported, but this was a false positive, checking the tx only rports its already in blockchain.
CFEKLF:  3009 confimed import with 0 fails.
CFEKMLT:  2216 confirmed import, with 159 reported fails... but this daemon crashed/locked up so its not really accuurate.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://github.com/StakedChain/komodo/blob/master/src/komodo_notary.h#L220 @dukeleto z

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: All you need is that, add a check for regtest and use a diffrent array of keys.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To get notarisations to be valid, that was the only change I needed to make to staked KMD

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So from this data so far, we can conclude that libscotts fix isnt required... but I think we need more data to know for sure. Also we know that FSM equal branch has problems, this mught help KMDICE tracking down the issue they have there.
